title: Anti-aging effects of medicinal plants and their rapid screening using the nematode Caenorhabditis elegans.
abstract: Aging is the primary risk factor of most chronic diseases in humans, including cardiovascular diseases, osteoporosis and neurodegenerative diseases, which extensively damage the quality of life for elderly individuals. Aging is a multifaceted process with numerous factors affecting it. Efficient model organisms are essential for the research and development of anti-aging agents, particularly when investigating pharmacological mechanisms are needed.
journal: Phytomedicine : international journal of phytotherapy and phytopharmacology
